column2: SESSION 1 TRAINING
FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK - BRIEF SCENARIO TRAINING
TOPIC CONGRUENT - 10 SCENARIOS FOR EACH DOMAIN
Note: 1 scenario has to have a negative ending, 2 scenarios have to have a resilience ending
ACADEMICS
Scenario
column3: Second part (resilience)
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You have a paper due in your history class next week. You haven't started it yet because you're unsure how to answer the prompt. When you think about the turning in the paper on time, you feel
column7: Are you worried about turning in your paper on time?

column2: You have a lot of homework due tomorrow. You've been procrastinating getting it done because it is going to be hard. When you think doing your homework tonight, you are
column7: Are you going to complete your homework?

column2: You studied hard for an important test. You see that you got a lower score than you expected. You think about whether you will be able to pull your grade up with the next test, and realize this was the last
column3: Right now you aren't happy, but you think about your overall course grade. You realize that you will
column7: Will you fail the class?

column2: The science fair is next week and you've been working hard on your project. You overheard your classmates joking that only "nerds" participate. You think about the fun you've had preparing your project, and feel
column7: Are you looking forward to participating in the science fair?

column2: Today is picture day and you got a new haircut for it. It didn't turn out the way you wanted it to. When you think about others seeing your new haircut in the yearbook, you feel
column7: Are others going to judge you when they see your picture in the yearbook?

column2: Your teacher is talking about your favorite book in class and she asks if anyone has read it. In front of everyone you quickly raise your hand and the class turns to you. You realize that you feel
column7: Are you embarrassed that you raised your hand?

column2: You've decided to go to community college after high school. You don't know anyone who is going to community college, and all of your friends are going to 4-year colleges. When you think about your decision, you feel like it's
column7: Are you satisfied with your decision to go to community college?

column2: A college recruiter is at your soccer game today. During the soccer game, you accidentally pass the ball to the other team. You feel
column3: While you feel upset, you realize that it's natural to make mistakes. You think that the college recruiter won't
column7: Is it okay that you made a mistake in front of the college recruiter?

column2: The teacher calls you to the board to complete a math problem. As you are working on the problem you hear a loud burst of laughter behind you. Your classmates are laughing at a
column7: Are your classmates laughing at you?

column2: You got your report card today and you got a couple lower grades than you expected. Your friends are talking about their grades, and they said they got straight As. If you tell your friends your grades, they will be
column7: Will your friends judge you for getting lower grades than them?

column2: Great job with those scenarios in your domain! Now you'll get to practice a few more scenarios that are from other domains. This will help you apply your flexible thinking skills to lots of different types of situations!

During your English class over Zoom, you're placed into breakout rooms. When you start the discussion, your camera is on but everyone else leaves their cameras off and their mics muted. You think that the others will think that you are
column7: Are the others in the class judging you?

column1: Number of likes on your post
column2: You have a lot of followers on social media. Your photo has only a few likes after a few hours, and usually by now you'd have a lot more reactions. You wonder if people aren't liking your post because you look
column3: You remember why you posted your picture in the first place. After you think about it, you look at your picture you feel
column7: Do you feel worried about having enough likes?

column2: You notice your parents are upset but you don't know what's wrong. They give you a short answer when you try to talk with them at dinner. You consider why they're mad, and realize that it is not
column7: Are they upset with you?

column2: It's a cold day, and you are outside jogging. Your heart starts to beat quickly a few minutes in. You decide that this feeling is
column7: Is your rapid heartbeat scary?

column2: You are babysitting a younger kid in your neighborhood and they just went to sleep. It's dark out and you suddenly hear noises outside. You peek out the window and see a
column7: Was there something scary outside in the dark?

column2: SOCIAL SITUATIONS

column2: Your friends are talking about drinking and ask if you've drank before. You haven't. If you tell them the truth they will think that you are
column7: Are your friends judging you for not drinking?

column2: You are hanging out with some friends. One of them invites another one to come over to their house on a different day without you. You think about it and realize you feel
column3: You remember that friends sometimes hang out separately. This makes you feel
column7: Was your friend trying to hurt your feelings by not inviting you?

column2: Your friend is having a get together tonight. You weren't invited, but most of your other friends were. When you think about it, you realize it's because you are
column7: Were you not invited because you were busy?

column2: You're in your online class and look at everyone's video. You notice that among the others, you look different from everyone else. You think about this and realize it is
column7: Is it bad that you feel different from everyone else?

column2: You send an intentionally bad picture of yourself to your friend through social media. You get a notification that they took a screenshot. Your friend probably thinks that you look
column7: Does your friend think you look good?

column2: You get invited to a pool party and you decide to wear a suit you got last year. You arrive and everyone else seems to have a swimsuit that is brand new. As you walk around, the host comes up to you and says you look
column7: Does the host of the party think you look bad?

column2: You are working at the grocery store bagging groceries and notice two friends. They are buying drinks and snacks, and they say hi as they're checking out. You feel
column3: You realize that they might have jobs, too. This makes you feel
column7: Do you feel anxious after seeing your friends?

column2: You walk into a quiet classroom a few minutes late. The door squeaks really loudly as you enter and classmates look in your direction. They are probably feeling
column7: Are your classmates annoyed that you disturbed them?

column2: Your grandmother is organizing a birthday party for you at her home. She invited a lot of people who will all be there for you. When you think about all of the people coming, you feel
column7: Are you excited about having people there to celebrate your birthday?

column2: You're hanging out with a new group of people. You tell a funny joke that you think goes along with the topic of conversation, and no one laughs. The new friends will find you
column7: Do the people in the new group think you're nice?

column2: PHYSICAL HEALTH

column2: You tell your caregiver that your tooth has been hurting recently, so they make you a dentist appointment. You think about the pain in your tooth and what it might be from. As you wait for your appointment, you will feel
column7: Can you handle going to the dentist?

column2: You're doing a mile run in gym class and you want to get a good time. You notice that your heart is racing more quickly than usual after you stop. You think that this is
column7: Is it bad that your heart is racing after the run?

column2: You have been anxious about an upcoming test for class. The day of the test, you notice that your stomach is aching. You think that the stomach ache must be from
column7: Is the stomach ache from anxiety?

column2: At your routine doctor's appointment, your doctor decides to run a few tests to evaluate your health. Your results will be ready within a week. While waiting for your results, you think you are likely
column7: Are you likely ill?

column2: You have experienced a dry mouth for a few days. This is something you haven't felt before. The likelihood that dry mouth means a serious health problem is
column7: Does your dry mouth signal that you are ill?

column2: You see an old friend you haven't spoken to in years. Your heart skips a beat. You feel
column7: Are you worried about your heart skipping a beat?

column2: You're walking with some friends after lunch and suddenly feel tingling in your finger tips. This is something that you haven't really experienced before. This probably means that you are
column7: Does the tingling in your fingers mean that you are sick?

column2: You are giving a presentation to your class about your research project. You feel that your hands are shaking a little. Wondering if it is obvious, you look around and see that a few classmates have
column3: You realize that your classmates are more interested in your presentation than your hands. You continue your presentation and as time passes you realize that your nerves are
column7: Are you able to handle your anxiety during your presentation?

column2: You see your friends across the street and jog over to them. You feel a little disoriented and dizzy as you reach them. You consider what this means, and realize that it probably means that you ran
column7: Are you scared by feeling slightly disoriented after your short jog?

column2: You decide to spin yourself really quickly on an office chair. You feel butterflies in your stomach and your head get dizzy as the chair slows down from spinning. These feelings probably mean that you are going to
column3: Instead of panicking, you decide to take a deep breathe. Slowly, your dizziness disapears and your stomach feels
column7: Are you worried about fainting?

column2: SOCIAL MEDIA
Scenario
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You look through your social media feed. You notice you posted a picture with your parents and none of your other friends have posted pictures with their family. Your followers must think that you're
column7: Do others think you're uncool for posting a picture with your parent?

column2: As you scroll through your social media, you see that your friends hung out without you last night. You didn't get an invite to hang out with them. You realize that sometimes your friends hang out without you and you feel
column3: You don't like being left out. But, you decide that you can tolerate this
column7: Can you handle that sometimes your friends hang out without you?

column2: You notice there are a lot of attractive people posting videos. You are a little uncomfortable posting a video, but post anyway. You feel
column7: Do you hold back from posting a video because you do not feel as attractive as the people you see in other videos?

column1: Your friend has a new friend
column2: As you scroll through your social media accounts, you see that your closest friend is hanging out with someone you don't know. You wonder who this person is, and why you haven't heard about them. When you think about your friendship with this friend, you feel
column7: Are you are upset that your friends were together without you?

column2: You posted a selfie on social media a few hours ago. Your best friend hasn't commented on it yet, even though they usually comment on your posts immediately and they just posted a photo of their own. You think that the post probably wasn't
column7: Is your best friend ignoring your posts?

column2: You check your score on a social media app. Your score is getting really high. If your score gets much higher, people will think that you use the app a lot and this makes you feel
column7: Do you care that people know you use this app a lot?

column2: You are trying come up with a caption for a new post. You come up with a risky joke that your closest friends will love. Your followers will think it's
column7: Are you worried what your followers will think of your caption?

column2: You go to post a story to your feed. As you arrange the post you wonder about the aesthetic of the story. You see all of the font and design options and feel
column3: You decide to continue to create your story and post it once you are happy with how it looks. You look forward to people's
column7: Are you worried about posting an aesthetically pleasing photo to your feed?

column2: On your social media account, you have a lot of direct messages (DMs). When you check your inbox you notice an explicit message from an account you don't know. You decide to report it and feel more
column7: Do you get anxious about the message you received?

column2: You meet a new classmate in your online class and they ask for your name on social media. When you tell them that you don't have that app, they grow quiet. They could be brainstorming other ways to contact you, which makes you feel
column7: Did your classmate get quiet because they were judging you?

column2: HOME LIFE
Scenario
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You get out your lunch at school in front of your friends. It smells very strong, as you notice your friends make faces. You tell your friends about what you're eating, and you feel
column7: Are you embarrassed by your lunch?

column2: You have a sports game after school today and both your parents are attending. They're divorced and sometimes cause an embarrassing scene in public. During the game, you think about your
column3: You take a deep breath and re-focus on the game. You decide that you can't control your parents'
column7: Are you able to concentrate on the game?

column2: You want to talk to someone about your plans for the future, but you don't think your parents will understand what you're worried about. You consider going to your mentor for advice, but you've never ask them for advice before. When you think about their reaction, you think they will probably be
column7: Do you feel worried about talking to your mentor about your plans for the future?

column2: You are invited to a school dance by your crush. You can't afford something new to wear, so have to wear your older sibling's outfit. When thinking about everyone's opinion on you wearing hand-me-downs, you know you'll feel
column7: Are you worried about what others will think of your hand-me-down outfit?

column2: Your parent runs a daycare out of your home, so it is always loud when you get home from school. Your friend is coming over after school today to work on a group project. You think about how your friend is going to react to the noise, and you get
column7: Are you calm about your friend coming over this afternoon?

column2: You invite your mentor to a school event this weekend. You're the only one of your friends with a mentor and are unsure of how others will percieve you. As you get ready for the event, you feel
column7: Are you happy to have your mentor come to your school event?

column2: Your friends ask you to go to an amusement park with them this weekend. It is really expensive and you know you won't be able to afford it. When you picture yourself telling your friends that you can't go, you feel
column3: You think about it a little more, and realize that you have really nice friends. When you tell them, they will be
column7: Will your friends be upset that you can't go to the amusement park?

column2: You get an idea for a new recipe that involve ingredients you have never used before. You make it for your family. As everyone starts to eat, you feel
column7: Are you worried about what your family will think of your cooking?

column2: Your family has traditions that your friends don't share. Today at school, everyone is sharing about their families' important traditions. As you prepare to speak, you feel
column7: Are you scared to talk about your family's traditions at school?

column2: You and your sibling share a computer. You have an assignment due tonight but they're using the computer. When you think about completing your homework on time, you feel
column7: Will you get your assignment done in time?

column2: You are at home alone watching TV at night. You must have been dozing, because you suddenly wake up after hearing a loud noise. You look outside and see a
column7: Should you be frightened when you hear a noise at night?

column2: You're going on a long car ride with your family to visit family in another part of the state. After an hour, you notice your phone battery is almost dead and you don't have a charger. You think about the rest of the car ride and feel like you will be
column3: After worrying about it for a few minutes, you realize that you can use this time to talk to your family. You feel
column7: Will the car ride be ok without your phone?

column2: You leave your house and get on the bus to go to school. About 10 minutes into the ride, you wonder whether you remembered to lock the door on your way out. As you get closer to school, you feel
column7: Are you very worried thinking about the front door?

column2: You are at a metro stop waiting for a train. Standing by the edge, you realize you've never thought about how far a drop it is to the rails below. You are
column7: Are you calm as you look at the rails below?

column2: You and your family are heading out of town for a few days. Your mom asks you to double-check that all the appliances in your house are turned off. As you close the door to your house, you feel
column7: Are you worried about whether you turned off everything in the house?

column2: You are auditioning for a play. You say most of your lines correctly but mess up on one or two.Â You think the audition went
column7: Do you feel good about the audition?

column2: You are on your way home after a soccer game that your team won. As your mind wanders, you think about the one goal that you missed. Overall, you consider your performance a
column7: Reflecting on the soccer game, do you think you played well?

column2: You and your friends have decided to go on a tour of a cave, even though you feel nervous about being in such an enclosed space. You walk deeper and deeper into the cool cave. You think the chances you will get trapped are
column3: You look around and see lots of similing faces. You decide that you are probably
column7: Are you probably going to be safe in the cave?

column7: Will your friend probably be OK?

column2: Your parent is a good driver, but today it is raining heavily. You wonder whether you should your parent to slow down, but you decide not to. The chances that you will get in an accident are
column7: Are you likely to get into an accident?
